data.description: If `true`, only transfers where user received NFTs are included in the response.
If `true`, only transfers where user sent NFTs are included in the response.
A timestamp in [unix epoch format](https://www.epochconverter.com/). If `true`, filter includes transfers from this date onwards (inclusive).
A timestamp in [unix epoch format](https://www.epochconverter.com/). If `true`, filter includes transfers up to this date (inclusive).
If `true`, only transfers which have param `possible_spam:false` are included in the response.
If `true`, only transfers which have param `possible_phishing:false` are included in the response.
The amount of this NFT the user owns (used by `ERC1155`).
The block height when the NFT was minted. May be `null`.
The block height when the amount or owner changed.
Chain name. One of `AVALANCHE`, `BSC`, `ETH`, `FANTOM`, or `POLYGON`.
May be `null`. An NFT collection name.
The type of NFT contract standard. One of `ERC721` or `ERC1155`.
When the token_uri was last updated.
May be `null` or a JSON stringified object containing NFT metadata.
A JSON object containing NFT metadata.
Indicates if the NFT collection is flagged as spam.
May be `null`. The symbol of the NFT collection.
When the NFT was last synced with the node.
The smart contract address of this NFT.
A hash uniquely identifying this NFT's metadata.
The token ID of this NFT.
May be `null`. A URI to the NFT metadata (Usually an IPFS link).
Indicates if the NFT is flagged as phishing.
Optional, defaults to `false`. If `true`, only tokens which have param `possible_spam:false` are included in the response.
Optional, defaults to `false`. If `true`, only tokens which have param `possible_phishing:false` are included in the response.
The amount of this NFT the user owns (used by `ERC1155`).
The block height when the NFT was minted. May be `null`.
The block height when the amount or owner changed.
Chain name. One of `AVALANCHE`, `BSC`, `ETH`, `FANTOM`, or `POLYGON`.
The type of NFT contract standard. One of `ERC721` or `ERC1155`.
When the token_uri was last updated.
When the metadata was last updated.
A JSON object containing NFT metadata. May be `null`.
Minter address. May be `null`.
The wallet address of the owner of the NFT.
If `true`, the contract address has [been identified](https://docs.moralis.io/web3-data-api/evm/nft-spam-detection) as associated with spam or suspicious activities.
If `true`, the token has been identified as associated with phishing, as at least one of domain fields is found in database with phishing domains.
When the token was last synced with the node.
The address of the NFT contract.
The token ID of the NFT.
The token hash. May be `null`.
The URI to the metadata of the token. May be `null`.
Token domain. May be `null`.
A standard [NftMetadata](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/nfts/#nft-metadata) object.
The amount of this NFT the user owns (used by `ERC1155`).
Chain name. One of `AVALANCHE`, `BSC`, `ETH`, `FANTOM`, or `POLYGON`.
The type of NFT contract standard. One of `ERC721` or `ERC1155`.
The address of the NFT contract.
The token ID of the NFT.
Direct URL to the NFT's image.
Url to the NFT's image. Derived from the `image` or `image_url` fields to prioritize the non-null value. Can be null if neither is provided.
Extracted domain from the 'image_url', if valid.
Name of the token.
Description of the token.
The values within this parameter will vary, and are set by the creator. Often used to store traits.
Url to an animation to be displayed instead of a static image.
Extracted domain from the `animation_url`, if valid.
URL to the external source related to the token.
Extracted domain from the `external_url`, if valid.
JSON containing additional details or attributes of the image.
Specifies the type of the provider.
Additional information about the provider
URL of the provider's endpoint
Indicates whether proxy authentication is enabled for the endpoint
Amount of tokens transferred.
May be `null`. Hash of block in which transfer occurred.
Height of block in which transfer occurred.
Block time in [unix epoch format](https://www.epochconverter.com/).
Chain name. One of `AVALANCHE`, `BSC`, `ETH`, `FANTOM`, or `POLYGON`.
May be `null`. The URI to the metadata of the token.
May be `null`. Extracted domain from the `token_uri`, if valid.
May be `null`. Name of collection which token belongs to.
May be `null`. The URI to the token image.
May be `null`. Extracted domain from the `image_url`, if valid.
May be `null`. Name of the token.
Contract type. `ERC721` or `ERC1155`.
Address of token transferred.
Token ID.
If `true`, the contract address has [been identified](https://docs.moralis.io/web3-data-api/evm/nft-spam-detection) as associated with spam or suspicious activities.
If `true`, the token has been identified as associated with phishing, as at least one of domain fields is found in database with phishing domains.
Transaction ID of the transfer.
May be `null`. Transaction index of the transfer.
Log index of the transfer.
May be `null`. Tranfer value.
May be `null`. Transaction type. Possible values are `Single`.
Address of previous owner which sent the token(s).
Address of new owner which received the token(s).
Transfer status. Will be either `Send` or `Receive`. When the `from_address` and `to_address` are the same (i.e. sending to yourself), this value will be `Receive`.
May be `null`. A deprecated field which will be removed in future.
May be `null`.
A standard [FeeInfo](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#fee-info) object.
The count of blocks produced since this transaction was confirmed.
If `true`, only transfers where user received NFTs are included in the response.
If `true`, only transfers where user sent NFTs are included in the response.
A timestamp in [unix epoch format](https://www.epochconverter.com/). If `true`, filter includes transfers from this date onwards (inclusive).
A timestamp in [unix epoch format](https://www.epochconverter.com/). If `true`, filter includes transfers up to this date (inclusive).
If `true`, only transfers which have param `possible_spam:false` are included in the response.
If `true`, only transfers which have param `possible_phishing:false` are included in the response.
Token type - e.g `ERC20` for tokens on the Ethereum network
Protocol-specific data object
The parent coin of the token's platform - e.g `MATIC` for PLG20 tokens

**Must be mixed case** The identifying hex string for the token's contract. Can be found on sites like [EthScan](https://etherscan.io/), [BscScan](https://bscscan.com/) & [PolygonScan](https://polygonscan.com/)
The contract address of the NFT
The ID of the NFT
The recipient's address
The amount to withdraw (for ERC1155 NFTs). For ERC721 NFTs, this is always `1` and can be omitted.
